atm

Class Bills

  • java.lang.Object
    • atm.Bills
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Bills
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Bills represents the bills in the ATM machine.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int[] bills
      A list that stores the number of each type of bill available in the ATM.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Field Detail

      • bills

        private final int[] bills
        A list that stores the number of each type of bill available in the ATM.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bills

        Bills(int five,
      int ten,
      int twenty,
      int fifty)
        Bills constructor.
        Parameters:
        five - number of $5 bills in the ATM
        ten - number of $10 bills in the ATM
        twenty - number of $20 bills in the ATM
        fifty - number of $50 bills in the ATM

    • Method Detail

      • setBills

        public void setBills(int bill,
                     int number)
        Sets the number of bills of a certain type of bill to number
        Parameters:
        bill - the index at which the type of bill (50, 20, 10, 5 dollar bill) is located
        number - the number of bills to set the type of bill to

      • getNumBills

        private int getNumBills(int index)
        Returns the number of a certain type of bill the ATM has.
        Parameters:
        index - the index at which the type of bill is located in the bills array
        Returns:
        the number of bills that the type of bill specified at index has

      • getTotalAmount

        public double getTotalAmount()
        Returns the total amount of money the ATM has
        Returns:
        the amount of money the ATM has

      • addBills

        public void addBills(int index,
                     int number)
        Adds a certain number of a type of bill to the ATM. Updates the bills array.
        Parameters:
        index - the index at which the type of bill (50, 20, 10, 5 dollar bill) is located in the bills array
        number - the number of bills to add to the ATM

      • removeBills

        private void removeBills(int index,
                         int number)
        Decreases the number of bills in the ATM.
        Parameters:
        index - the index at which the type of bill ($50, $20, $10, $5 bill) is located in the bills array
        number - the number of bills to remove from the ATM

      • withdrawBills

        public void withdrawBills(double amount)
        Withdraws a certain amount from the ATM. This method will optimize the amount of bills to withdraw from the ATM. The user will receive the smallest number of bills possible.
        Parameters:
        amount - the total amount the user wants to withdraw, this amount has to be an integer that is divisible by 5 because you cannot withdraw cents from the ATM and there are only 5, 10, 20, 50 dollar bills available in the ATM

      • maximizeBillWithdrawal

        private int maximizeBillWithdrawal(int amountToWithdraw,
                                   int typeOfBill,
                                   int index)
        Returns the number of a certain type of bill to withdraw from the ATM and updates bills array with the new amount of bills in the ATM after withdrawal.

        Depending on the amount of money that the user wants to withdraw, this method will maximize how many of a certain type of bill (either a 50, 20, 10, or 5) the ATM will withdraw.

        Parameters:
        amountToWithdraw - the amount of money the user wants to withdraw from the ATM
        typeOfBill - the type of bill to withdraw (either a 50, 20, 10 or 5 dollar bill)
        index - the index where typeOfBill is stored in bills array
        Returns:
        the number of a certain type of bill to withdraw

      • alertManager

        private void alertManager()
        Alerts the manager when the amount of any denomination of bills goes below 20. The alert is written alerts.txt to which the Bank Manager has accessed to.

      • writeObject

        private void writeObject(java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Used to serialize the Bills object.
        Parameters:
        oos - instance of the ObjectOutputStream class to serialize the Bills object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs.

      • readObject

        private void readObject(java.io.ObjectInputStream ois)
                 throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Used to deserialize the Bills object after the ATM is rebooted.
        Parameters:
        ois - instance of the ObjectInputStream class used to deserialize the Bills object
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the class of the serialized object could not be found
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs

      • readObjectNoData

        private void readObjectNoData()
                       throws java.io.ObjectStreamException
        Used in serialization when class inheritance is not as expected*
        Throws:
        java.io.ObjectStreamException - when an attempt to deserialize a back-reference fails
